injuries.shortComment: Barnes (knee) is out for Friday's game against the Clippers, Law Murray of The Athletic reports.
injuries.longComment: Barnes was questionable ahead of Friday's matchup due to knee tendinitis, and he'll be unable to play through the issue. Chris Boucher, OG Anunoby and Justin Champagnie should see increased work against the Clippers.

injuries.shortComment: Johnson (calf) has been downgraded to out for Friday's contest against the Clippers.
injuries.longComment: Coach Nick Nurse said he expected Johnson to be available, but Johnson apparently needs more time off to recover from his left calf strain. His next chance to take the court is Sunday against the Knicks.

injuries.shortComment: Dragic (personal) remained away from the team during Sunday's 144-99 loss to the Cavaliers and is without a timeline to rejoin the Raptors, Ryan Wolstat of the Toronto Sun reports.
injuries.longComment: Dragic had been part of Toronto's rotation for only five of the team's first 21 games before leaving the club to tend to personal affairs. Toronto could certainly use him at the moment after the team was without 11 other players Sunday, 10 of whom are in the NBA's COVID-19 health and safety protocols. However, the club has provided no indication that Dragic is close to a return, and at this point, it wouldn't be surprising if he's played his last game with the Raptors.
